title: ICE: Procedural Macro Stack Overflow

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code
The code here effectively boils down to this, but there's a procedural macro involved so I've made a repository. For now, this is the smallest example I've found. I'll narrow it down further when I have the time.
```rs
#[ion_proc::js_fn]
fn many_inputs(_cx: &Context, _args: &Arguments, #[ion(this)] _this: Object, #[ion(convert = ConversionBehavior::EnforceRange)] _integer: i8, #[ion(strict)] _boolean: bool, #[ion(convert = (), strict)] _string: String, _function: Function, _promise: Promise, #[ion(varargs)] _values: Vec<Value>) {}
```
Upon running `cargo check`, the compiler experiences an ICE.
Repository: <https://github.com/Redfire75369/rustc-ice-minimal>

### Meta
Stable `rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.64.0 (a55dd71d5 2022-09-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52
commit-date: 2022-09-19
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.64.0
LLVM version: 14.0.6
```
Nightly `rustc +nightly --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.66.0-nightly (bed4ad65b 2022-10-25)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: bed4ad65bf7a1cef39e3d66b3670189581b3b073
commit-date: 2022-10-25
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.66.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.2
```

### Error Output
There is no impact from `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` or `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` and no change in output when switching to nightly.
Stable:
```
C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal>set RUST_BACKTRACE=full

C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal>cargo check
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.47
   Compiling quote v1.0.21
   Compiling syn v1.0.103
   Compiling unicode-ident v1.0.5
   Compiling prettyplease v0.1.21
    Checking ion-proc v0.1.0 (C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal\ion-proc)
    Checking rustc-ice v0.1.0 (C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal\rustc-ice)

thread 'rustc' has overflowed its stack
error: could not compile `rustc-ice`

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name rustc_ice --edition=2021 rustc-ice\src\lib.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi,artifacts,future-incompat --crate-type lib --emit=dep-info,metadata -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=b11bd356c9a89a99 -C extra-filename=-b11bd356c9a89a99 --out-dir C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal\target\debug\deps -C incremental=C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal\target\debug\incremental -L dependency=C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal\target\debug\deps --extern ion_proc=C:\Users\Redfire\software\rustc-ice-minimal\target\debug\deps\ion_proc-b0e6f9253bb58dd2.dll` (exit code: 0xc00000fd, STATUS_STACK_OVERFLOW)
```
Stable/Nightly: <https://paste.gg/p/redfire/8a8542cbd30b4d95b0b036c71a5e3b65>
